content:

title: Cannot add security exception after update to TB snap 140.2.0esr (64-bits) - dialog freezes
content:
Hi all, After updating my snap Thunderbird to version 140.2.0esr (64-bit) on a Kubuntu 24.04.03 system, one of my email accounts is no longer able to send emails because the certificate is not recognised.

Adding a security exception always helped (because it concerns my own domain), but now the Thunderbird dialogue box freezes when creating an exception. Even entering the domain directly into security.tls.insecure_fallback_hosts (via about:config) does not result in the server setting I always used before the update being accepted.

Could it be that this component contains a bug? How could I test it? Perhaps someone has some ideas?

Thank you in advance for your input.

Marc
creator: vivideo

title: Copy the sender's email address from a mail does not work under Linux Mint
content:
Hi -

Copying the sender's email address to the clipboard does not work.

I am using Thunderbird 128.14.0esr (64-bit) on Linux Mint 21 Vanessa.

This is what I do:

  1. Open a mail that I received
  2. Right-click or double-click on the sender address (it is highlighted when the mouse hovers above it)
  3. Nothing happens. Expected: a dialogue with a popup menu containing "copy"

Work-around: reply to the message, then copy the email address (which works) and discard the reply.
creator: pieter35

title: Thunderbird not downloading messages from Outlook
content:
I am having a problem downloading emails from Outlook. The problem appears if the message has already been read first on my phone. If I read an email from an Outlook account on my phone, that email will not be downloaded to an Inbox on Thunderbird.

I can take the read but not downloaded messages and copy them into an archive folder synced to TB. The messages are then synced to my desktop. I then move them to the Inbox. Its a bit of a circuitous route but it gets the messages to go where they need to go.

I have reviewed the settings in the account for TB and have the "synchronize all messages" selection checked. Are there any other account settings I need to change?
creator: mkostura

title: unable to setup hotmail account
content:
Hi,

I am trying to setup Thunderbird for the first time on my mac (OS Sequoia 15.6.1). No problem with E-mail clients except the hotmail client. I am always stuck at this error message that authentication failed after I type in my password. I added manually an outgoing server for microsoft as described in some older post but I am unable to find to setup IMAP manually in the Thunderbird account settings. I believe I will have only the option to do so after I pass the authentication error. I also added some exception as recommended in some older forum post but it also didn't help.

Any suggestion what could solve the problem?
creator: sauerbierhenry

title: Thunderbird Bug? tweede mailadres toevoegen werkt niet in versie 142.0 (64 bits)
content:
Ik heb net een nieuwe computer gekocht. Die werkt als een zonnetje.

Nu heb ik Thunderbird gedownload en wil ik mijn e-mail adressen toevoegen om mijn mails op te halen. De eerste gaat prima, hij zoekt zelf de server instellingen op en dat werkt prima. Maar als ik een tweede e-mail adres wil toevoegen begint de ellende. Na het invoeren van mijn naam en e-mailadres gaat hij automatisch op ziek naar de serverinstellingen en blijft hij zoeken, uren lang. En hij vind niets. Handmatig deze instellingen is niet meer mogelijk, ik kan dat tenminste niet vinden. Doordat ik bij vier organisaties actief ben heb ik dus ook vier mailadressen plus nog twee persoonlijke adressen heb, waarvan ik de mail niet meer kan ophalen zoals dat eerder (voor de laatste update op de oude computer wel gewoon kon doen.)

Wie kan mij vertellen hoe ik dit kan oplossen, zodat ik al mijn e-mailadressen weer normaal kan gebruiken?
creator: jelle.berends
